title: Number of troops on Kosovo border 'back to normal,' Serbia says
description: The number of Serbian troops deployed near the border with Kosovo has been cut from 8,350 to 4,500, according to the Serbian army.

title: The trial of Sam Bankman-Fried, the 'Mozart of crypto,' and the bankruptcy of FTX
description: Charged with fraud and money laundering, Bankman-Fried faces more than a hundred years in prison. His trial is set to begin on Tuesday.

title: Rishi Sunak's decisive fight to save his party from defeat
description: The British prime minister, who took over from Liz Truss a year ago, has been battling to tame the Conservative Party, whose annual conference opened on Sunday, October 1. After four chaotic years marked by a string of Tory prime ministers, he will be trying to save his party from a predicted defeat in the 2024 general election.

title: Armenia, Russia claim attacks following Nagorno-Karabakh exodus
description: In separate statements on Monday, October 2, the Armenian and Russian defense ministries claimed attacks on their servicemen, highlighting regional tensions.

title: Slovakia accuses Russia of election interference
description: The accusation concerns 'deliberately dissemination misinformation' from the Russian foreign intelligence chief concerning Slovakia's election on Saturday, September 30.

title: After the 2004 tsunami in Indonesia, a surprising legacy of peace
description: 'Living after a disaster' (1/6). Le Monde retraces the paths of major natural disasters and shows how life has gone on in the aftermath, the ongoing stories and lessons learned. On December 26, 2004, a series of tsunami waves hit the island of Sumatra, killing more than 160,000 people in the province of Aceh, which at the time was gripped by warfare with separatist guerrillas. As humanitarian aid poured in, international mediation helped facilitate peace agreements with the Indonesian government.

title: Hollywood screenwriters come out ahead after 148 days on strike
description: The ratification process for the agreement reached between the writers' union and the studios begins on Monday, October 2. Meanwhile, negotiations are resuming with the actors, who are still on strike.

title: 50th anniversary of Yom Kippur War: The enduring ambiguity of Pax Americana
description: The Arab-Israeli war of October 1973 provoked a major crisis between Saudi Arabia and the United States, forcing the latter to sponsor peace negotiations.

title: TotalEnergies faces criminal charges for 'failing to fight' climate disaster and 'manslaughter'
description: The organizations behind the legal action believe that the oil company is pursuing a 'climate-killing' policy by continuing to develop fossil fuel projects, contrary to scientific recommendations.

title: Trump appeared in court for his New York civil fraud trial
description: Trump isn't expected to testify for several weeks in this lawsuit that already has resulted in a judge ruling that he committed fraud in his business dealings.

title: Researchers who enabled mRNA Covid vaccine win medicine Nobel Prize
description: Katalin Kariko and Drew Weissman have made a major contribution to the development of the revolutionary technology used in Covid-19 vaccines.

title: Macron's camp keen on presenting AI as an opportunity
description: The French president's loyal followers are insisting on the potential artificial intelligence represents for France, using it as a dividing issue with the far right.

title: Nobel Prize in Medicine awarded to Katalin Karikó and Drew Weissman for work that enabled mRNA Covid vaccine
description: The pair will receive their prize, consisting of a diploma, a gold medal and a $1 million cheque, at a formal ceremony in Stockholm on December 10.

title: French far-right leader seeks to take advantage of AI debate
description: Contrary to his party's conservative position, the president of the Rassemblement National is supporting the creation of European AI champions.

title: Slovakia is on the verge of rapprochement with Russia
description: Former Slovakian prime minister Robert Fico won Saturday's parliamentary elections following a campaign marked by promises to halt military aid to Ukraine and social media messages aligned with Kremlin positions.

title: EU convenes 'historic meeting' of foreign ministers in Kyiv
description: 'Ukraine's future lies within the EU,' said the EU's foreign policy chief Josep Borrell.

title: France to vaccinate millions of ducks against bird flu
description: Vets expect a total of around 60 million ducks should be vaccinated by summer next year. But the campaign is not going uncontested.

title: In Warsaw, the democratic opposition is galvanized by a gigantic rally
description: Former Polish prime minister Donald Tusk has succeeded in his ambitious bid to mobilize almost a million people two weeks ahead of the October 15 parliamentary elections, which are crucial for the ruling Law and Justice party.

title: At least 10 killed in Mexico church roof collapse
description: The disaster struck the coastal town of Ciudad Madero in Tamaulipas state.

title: California governor chooses Laphonza Butler to fill Feinstein Senate seat
description: In choosing Butler, Newsom fulfilled his pledge to appoint a Black woman if Feinstein’s seat should become open.

title: Europe's Green Deal machine is stalling
description: Many of the European Union's heads of state and government leaders have called for a 'regulatory pause' on climate and environmental issues. They are concerned about the consequences of measures designed to lead the EU-27 to carbon neutrality.

title: 'From hunters to hunted:'  A growing sense of unease among French police forces
description: The urban violence that shook France at the start of the summer had a major impact on frontline police. Le Monde's investigation shows the extent to which this ultra-violent period has heightened their malaise and a deepening sense of injustice.

title: Non-white recent graduates in France face hiring discrimination
description: Young executives from working-class neighborhoods and immigrant backgrounds continue to encounter workplace discrimination based on their origins, compounding the challenges they already faced during their educational journeys.

title: Western Sahara, an unresolved dispute between Paris and Rabat
description: Morocco has criticized France for not explicitly recognizing Moroccan sovereignty over this territory, which lies to its south.

title: Turkey conducts airstrikes on PKK targets in northern Iraq
description: The operation follows a PKK suicide bombing in Ankara and reflects Turkey's ongoing efforts to combat the group in Iraqi Kurdistan.
